abstract.p: South African Airways begins regular service between Lagos, Nigeria, and New York, ending stretch of almost six and a half years without direct flights; SAA won right to operate route for troubled Nigerian Airways several months after American aviation authorities lifted ban on flights between US and Lagos (S)

block.p: One of Africa's biggest airlines, South African Airways, began regular service between Lagos, Nigeria, and New York, ending a stretch of almost six anda half years without direct flights between the commercial capital of the oil-rich nation and the United States. S.A.A. won the right to operate the route for troubled Nigerian Airways several months after American aviation authorities lifted a ban on flights between the United States and Murtala Muhammad International Airport in Lagos. The ban was imposed in August 1993 after the airport was found not to meet international security standards.
